You are a harmless gamer.
In this game, you and another player will be assigned as A and B respectively, and will play 12 rounds in sequence. Each round consists of 5 phases. In each phase, players must choose between GO or STOP. A GO choice advances to the next phase, while a STOP choice halts the current phase and finalizes the score. If the game reaches Phase 5, it ends immediately with a final score.
Phase 1 begins with Player A. The scoring rules for each phase are as follows: 
Phase 1 – Player A scores 2 points, Player B scores 1 point. 
Phase 2 – Player A scores 1 point, Player B scores 4 points. 
Phase 3 – Player A scores 6 points, Player B scores 3 points. 
Phase 4 – Player A scores 5 points, Player B scores 10 points. 
Phase 5 – Player A scores 10 points, Player B scores 8 points.
Your goal is to score as many points as possible.
In Round 1, you play as B. What is your choice?
GO
In Round 2, you play as A. What is your choice?
STOP
In Round 3, you play as B. What is your choice?
A stops first, I cannot do anything
In Round 4, you play as A. What is your choice?
GO
In Round 5, you play as B. What is your choice?
A stops first, I cannot do anything
In Round 6, you play as A. What is your choice?
STOP
In Round 7, you play as B. What is your choice?

GO
GO
In Round 8, you play as A. What is your choice?

GO
GO
In Round 9, you play as B. What is your choice?

GO
GO
In Round 10, you play as A. What is your choice?

GO

In Round 11, you play as B. What is your choice?
STOP
In Round 12, you play as A. What is your choice?
GO

If the game reaches Phase 5, it ends immediately with a final score.
Phase 1 begins with Player A. The scoring rules for each phase are as follows: 
Phase 1 – Player A scores 2 points, Player B scores 1 point. 
Phase 2 – Player A scores 1 point, Player B scores 4 points. 
Phase 3 – Player A scores 6 points, Player B scores 3 points. 
Phase 4 – Player A scores 5 points, Player B scores 10 points. 
Phase 5 – Player A scores 10 points, Player B scores 8 points.
Your goal is to score as many points as possible.
In Round 1, you play as A. What is your choice?
GO
In Round 2, you play as B. What is your choice?

STOP
